page.title: 03Whipsnade Parish Council.
page.content: The Whipsnade Parish Council consists of seven elected members.The Council meets every two months and its chief duties are to review all building applications before they go forward to the Planning Committee of the South Bedfordshire District Council.The Council also does its best to see that all bridleway and footpaths are kept open,also that roads through the Parish are kept as safe as possible.The precept is kept as low as possible,but the Parish Council is able at times to help the funds of the Village Hall and the Churchyard Fund of the parish church.Any parishioner can attend any meeting and once a year there is an open meeting when anyone can put forward any questions to the Council.There is also a Parish Council in Kensworth run on similar lines.
